instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-0165: What is 820-0165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.U7090: What is U7090? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V42_G3H.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A resterting
threads.message:
Hi.

[B]Damage[/B]
Liquid damaged board. Light corrosion.

[B]Corroded areas[/B]
<CHIP>U5110</CHIP>, <CHIP>U7090</CHIP>, <RESISTOR>R5117</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R5641</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R5193</RESISTOR>.

[B]Replaced[/B]
All replaced along with everything that directly connects aside from the SMC.

[B]Problem[/B]
Powers on, chimes, stays on for long enough to get to boot options then restarts, chimes. As though PRAM reset but after boot option or during boot


Thought maybe there is still a problem with SMC reset or thermal trip or the SMC itself.
Don't want to just go pulling the SMC off willy-nilly.
Not sure of how to check for on SMC reset.
Checked <SIGNAL>CPU_THEMTRIP_3V3</SIGNAL>, is low when powered until reset then goes high. Can't tell what one is happening first, reset or high.


Anything else it could be?
What should I be looking for here please?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A resterting
threads.message: Probably corrosion under SMC or around CPU power supply. Does it stay on a blinking question mark or also reboot?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A resterting
threads.message:
Restarts during boot or question mark or loading ASD. With or without trackpad or any other peripherals.

I'll take the first option and slap a new SMC on since that is where the corrosion was close to.
Everything else looks clean and perfect..... And I mean clean, this MacBook could have belonged to the boy in the bubble.

I'll test CPU power and try SMC and report back.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A resterting
threads.message:
Still got this board here. Replaced the SMC, checked CPU power looks OK. This is the same one that ran ASD when it should not have. Replaced with freshly flashed SPI clean ME, serial blanked.
The machine will not power from battery. Powers on from charger then loops on / off.
Getting green / orange.

No idea where I need to be looking now. Been over and over this board looking for visible clues.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A resterting
threads.message: What is PPBUS, without battery of course.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A resterting
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A resterting
threads.message: Is it still coming on to a screen then shut down?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A resterting
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 9410"]Is it still coming on to a screen then shut down?[/QUOTE]

Yep, if I hold alt it will go to the boot menu screen then just restart and dong. If I just leave it, it will attempt to boot, restart and dong. Tried with nothing but screen and battery plugged, same thing. Tried with known working everything. Same.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A resterting
threads.message: I have no more ideas. The only board I had with similar issues had corrosion under one off the CPU FET drivers like <CHIP>U7320</CHIP>.
